page.title: 02FORESTRY _ THE HIGH MEADOW 1
page.content: The{Forest of Dean}has a very wide variety of trees and in the{High {Meadow}area of this D block there is a 50/50 split between{deciduous (oak, beech, chestnut, birch, alder) and{coniferous}trees (Corsican pine, European, Japanese and Hybrid larch, Norway spruce Douglas fir and red cedar). The forest is carefully managed and the trees are generated in one of three ways: {1.Replanting}of cleared areas with young tree brought from elsewhere. {2.Broadleaf}trees can be{Coppiced} _ the trees are cut but the roots left and this makes them grow. {3.Natural regeneration}is encouraged _ mainly oak and beech. In recent years the forest has been greatly affected by{Dutch Elm } {Disease.
